Header: Insurancescheme to be launched for Buddhist monks in temples having less facilities
Content: Minister Gamini Jayawickrema Perera has said that an insurance scheme will be started for Buddhist monks in temples having less facilities. The unveiling of the Ranveta of surrounding the Bodhiya of the Sri Abeysunderarama Vihare at Mandawila in Angoda took place under the patronage of Ministers Gamini Jayawickrema Perera and Ravi Karunanayake. The Ranveta was put up from personal contributions made by a philanthropistâ€™s couple. Among those present were the Chief Incumbent the Ven. Komarike Subodhananda Thera and members of the Maha Sangha. Minister Gamini Jayawickrema Perera he said that monks in remotes are leading a difficult life. They do not receive alms nor do they have Sanghawasa. He said that the basic requirement of the Sangha is the support to protect the Sasana. Minister Ravi Karunanayake said that they have to embark on a programme to end the narcotics war to protect the future generation. He said that the members of the Mahasangha should take the lead in this respect.
